title.narrative: REACH Food & NFI assistance for vulnerable households displaced by the Anbar & Ninewa NCCA

description.narrative: The project will focus on two cross-cuttings issues of gender and protection. Female-headed households will be prioritised in targeting; women’s needs will be considered for the composition of the NFI kits (for example, sanitary pads will be included). Vulnerable groups will be prioritised in beneficiary selection; REACH will coordinate with specialist agencies and CBOs to ensure that vulnerable groups are included and their needs considered and results will be validated through information from IDP registrations by UNHCR/IOM; distributions will be arranged at community centres which are central, familiar and safe.

This project will support CA partner REACH to provide emergency food and non-food assistance, which have been identified as priority needs in initial assessments, to displaced households in Chamchamal, Sulimaniya to cover priority needs for up to 3 months. The project will target 341 displaced households (1,705 ppl) with food assistance and 30 vulnerable households with non-food item assistance. The initial focus will be on the non-camp IDP groups in Chamchamal, Sulymaniya[1] but displaced populations inside the camps in Chamchamal will also be assessed and targeted if a camp is built. The majority of IDPs are women and children; they and other groups with special needs will be prioritised in beneficiary selection. Relief items will be distributed in coordination with local IDP leaders, government officials and other key humanitarian agencies. REACH is trained in HAP principles and will ensure that community accountability mechanisms are established.
